intro: Bidaria, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Bidaria species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions around the world. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage.
